page.title: 11Godfrey's Bungalow
page.content: Godfrey's Bungalow, owned by Mr. and Mrs. Double specializes in Tomato growing. They have three greenhouses, each covering one third of an acre. The boiler which heats them uses 8 gallons of oil an hour. In February the greenhouse soil is rotavated, then flooded for a week. The Marathon variety of plants are put into border soil in March. One truss forms each week. The tomato plants are subject to pests such as whitefly and red spider. The tomatoes are ready for picking by mid June and the season goes on until mid Movember, when the greenhouses are sterilised. Tomatoes are graded on a machine which would cost between Â£1500 and Â£2000 to replace. They are boxed and sent to Stratford Market. 25 tons of tomatoes are grown each year.
